Row.Text: I don't believe I've seen you here before. Today, your travels have brought you to the land of the Anangu.
You have defiled the sacred paths we all must walk... I can at least take comfort in the knowledge that I will not witness the gods' revenge.
Like the fly, you are intent on bothering me; and so, like the fly, I will swat you down.
There are few who understand the ways of tjukurpa, but you are one of them. Would you be interested in a public Declaration of Friendship?
I wish that, when I had first met you, I had left you in the desert to die.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I have realized that my life would be simpler if you were not part of it.
The songlines demarcate a great bounty of land as rightfully Anangu. You would be wise to obey them.
Consider yourself fortunate that I've deigned to speak with you.
Hello again! I see our paths continue to intertwine.
Oh, it's you! I thought for a moment you might be a mirage.
Frankly, I'd rather you didn't come here so often.
Your soldiers are trying to traverse the songlines. You should remind them that they are for Anangu use only.
Well, if I must play the diplomat, I may as well get something for it. Show me what you've got.
Well, I know when I am beaten. But once I have regained my strength, do not expect me to be docile.
I am intrigued by the wealth of your people. Perhaps I could negotiate for some of your finer goods?
Well, I see you've realized that attrition will always favor the Anangu. I am not done with you yet.
I yearn to travel even beyond the confines of my land. May I pass through yours?
You'll need to be more reasonable to justify my coming out here.
The desert is a hostile place... but with your donation, it could become less oppressively so.
I don't want to deal with you right now. Get out of my sight.
What's wrong? Can't brave the desert?
It has been no secret that the Anangu would eventually triumph.
